Introduction

Kim Young Woon, also known as Kangin, is a South Korean singer, actor, MC and radio DJ. He is popularly known for being a former member of the boy group SUPER JUNIOR under SM Entertainment. He is also a former member of its sub-units SUPER JUNIOR-T and SUPER JUNIOR-H.

In addition to singing, he is also known for hosting programs including A Song For You and Show Champion.

In 2002, Kangin won first place on the fourth annual SM Youth Best Contest and won the best outward appearance award and signed a contract with SM Entertainment.

He enlisted in the military on July 5, 2010 and was discharged on April 16, 2012.

Kangin officially left the group on July 11, 2019.
